Most meteor showers are caused by leftover bits of comets, but the Geminids come from remnants of an asteroid known as 3200 Phaethon.
The eye-catching colors of the Geminids — ranging from yellows to reds and even greenish hues — owe to the chemical composition of the asteroid debris.

title: Despite denials, top DeSantis aides have ties to a controversial gubernatorial candidate
summary: While Gov. Ron DeSantis has not endorsed in the governor's race, at least two top aides have been in touch with James Fishback.
story: A top aide to Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis has been communicating with Republican gubernatorial candidate James Fishback, a controversial figure who has denied any interactions with the governor’s political orbit.

The aide, Christina Pushaw, has spoken to Fishback, his top adviser and Fishback’s uncle — South Florida investor and real estate mogul Fred Fishback — about Fishback’s gubernatorial campaign, according to a person familiar with the relationship and Fishback’s uncle.

Last month, Fishback jumped into the 2026 Republican primary to succeed DeSantis — who is term-limited and cannot run again — as a pro-DeSantis candidate who backs the outgoing governor’s agenda. The front-runner is currently Rep. Byron Donalds, who has Trump’s endorsement but is at odds with DeSantis. It’s widely believed the governor is still looking for a candidate to support.

Those in DeSantis’ political orbit have pushed back against claims that they are helping or advising Fishback, whose prolific social media presence has faced criticism. Fishback has repeatedly called Donalds, who is Black, a “slave” to his political donors, and he has praised followers of Nick Fuentes, a far-right activist known for his white nationalist and antisemitic views, as “impressive.”
When asked about any ties to Fishback’s orbit, Pushaw said she was not working for the campaign.
“The story is simply not accurate,” she told NBC News Thursday night. “I do not work for James Fishback and never have.”

Pushaw has been one of DeSantis’ most high-profile advisers. She helped build his popular reputation and social media profile with national Republican voters ahead of his 2024 bid for president. Pushaw also grew her own following with conservatives because of her social media presence and the aggressive way in which she, at times publicly, battled with reporters.
Pushaw has been a Florida state employee since 2021, including serving as DeSantis’ press secretary. She currently makes $180,000 working as a “senior management analyst,” state records show.

NBC News viewed a video showing Fishback’s uncle, Fred, answering questions from a small group of people at the opening night party of a Noble Capital Markets conference held last week in Boca Raton that indicates Pushaw is involved with his political efforts. During the event, Fred Fishback can be heard answering questions from a small group of people about Pushaw’s involvement in his nephew’s campaign, and claiming he himself has spoken to her.
“I don’t know anything about her, other than we had a nice talk,” Fred Fishback said, according to the video from Dec. 2. “She seems to be a smart girl.”
In the video, Fred Fishback said that Pushaw told him that she had reached out to his nephew after admiring his rapid-fire social media posts focused on conservative politics.
“She liked whatever he said, and she just reached out to him,” Fred Fishback said in the video. “All I know is she said he reached out to him because she liked her Twitter stuff.”
“They sat down and started talking,” he said.
Fred Fishback was at the event because he has been longtime friends with rapper Vanilla Ice, who was receiving an award.

Fred Fishback confirmed in a text message to NBC News that he discussed Pushaw at the event. He said he talked to her one day when he was driving to pick up his son from college, but he didn’t specify the date. He said during that phone call with Pushaw, there were some “financial-type questions,” but no direct ask for any sort of political contributions.

“To be clear, neither Christina nor James have explicitly asked for my financial support for his campaign, and she specifically told me on our call she was not being paid by James,” he said, adding, “I do genuinely wish everyone the best, especially my nephew as well as my wonderful State of Florida.”
Pushaw told NBC News she doesn’t know Fred Fishback.
James Fishback told NBC News on Friday that his uncle was “dead wrong” and added that Pushaw did not work for him.

“Honestly, my uncle is the last person who should be taking questions about my campaign since I have barely spoken to him about it and do not seek to involve him,” he said, adding that he and his uncle disagree on a number of issues — including AI data centers and H-1B visas — but that he loves him “dearly.”
He acknowledged he had dinner with Pushaw in October before he decided to run for governor because she is “brilliant.”
Last month, NBC News reported that a separate DeSantis adviser, Taryn Fenske, was also communicating with Fishback, but at the time he said he was not in communication with Pushaw.
It’s unclear if DeSantis is aware that two of his top aides are in communication with Fishback. His office did not return a request seeking comment.

Fishback aide Alex Mungia said during a dinner that the campaign had been talking directly with Pushaw in some capacity, according to a source directly familiar with the conversation, who said it took place a few weeks ago.

The person told NBC News that Mungia told them the campaign has the full support of DeSantis’ team. The person said they asked if that support was coming from Pushaw, to which Mungia replied, “Who told you?”
“He admitted it fully,” the person said of Mungia discussing Pushaw being involved with the campaign.
When asked about the dinner, Mungia praised Fishback.
“James Fishback has been a great friend, and will make an incredible governor for our state,” he said.

In a social media post written at 11 p.m. on Thursday, James Fishback said that over the weekend, his uncle urged him to leave the governor’s race and endorse Florida Lt. Gov. Jay Collins, who is considering a run. James Fishback alleged Collins lobbied his uncle to help get him out of the race.

“Today I learned that @JayCollinsFL went to my own uncle and asked him to pressure me to drop out of the Florida Governor race,” Fishback posted. “After meeting with Collins without my knowledge, my uncle called me over the weekend urging me to drop out and endorse Collins.”
Pushaw retweeted Fishback’s post.
Collins said he is focused on his day job, not the Fishback allegations.
“Lt. Gov. Jay Collins is focused on serving the people,” a spokesperson for Collins said. “Not false and fabricated stories.”
During the conference last week in Boca Raton, Fred Fishback was asked if he thought his nephew was being “used” as part of his race for governor, and he seemed to agree with the sentiment.
“I can see the crash,” he said, according to the video. “I can see the crash and burn, and he does not see it.”

title: Is ‘SNL’ New this Week? Here's Who’s Hosting December 13
summary: Who is hosting "SNL" tonight, Dec. 13, 2025? What to know about Josh O'Connor and Lily Allen.
story: With the end of the year quickly approaching, there are only a couple new episodes of “Saturday Night Live” on the way.

So far during Season 51, hosts Amy Poehler, Bad Bunny, Glen Powell, Sabrina Carpenter and more celebrities have appeared in Studio 8H with musical guests like Doja Cat, Olivia Dean and Role Model. They’ve acted out skits alongside “SNL” staples, like Kenan Thompson and Bowen Yang, as well as the five new featured players this season: Tommy Brennan, Jeremy Culhane, Ben Marshall, Kam Patterson and Veronika Slowikowska.

Last week, Melissa McCarthy hosted the show for the sixth time. She opened the episode by delivering a monologue celebrating her return before appearing in skits where she played a UPS delivery driver, an awkward grocery shopper and more. She was joined by musical guest Dijon.
Here's what to know about the Dec. 13 episode of "SNL."
Is There a New Episode of ‘SNL’ This Weekend?
Yes, the next new episode of Season 51 will air Saturday, Dec. 13.

The episode features first-time host Josh O’Connor, who currently stars in “Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery.” The movie, the third entry in the “Knives Out franchise,” was released in theaters on Nov. 26 and hit Netflix Dec. 12.
British singer Lily Allen will serve as musical guest and play songs from her scathing new breakup album, “West End Girl,” which she released in October.
Allen last appeared on "SNL"  as the musical guest 18 years ago, appearing alongside host Drew Barrymore in 2007 to perform songs from her debut album, "Alright, Still."
How to Watch ‘SNL’
Comedy fans can tune into “SNL” live on NBC at 11:30 p.m. The show will also be available to stream on Peacock the following day. (TODAY.com, Peacock and NBC share a parent company, NBCUniversal.)
When Is the Next New Episode of ‘SNL’?

The final new “SNL” episode of 2025 will air on Dec. 20. “Wicked: For Good” star Ariana Grande will close the season when she hosts the show for the third time. Her return to “SNL” for the 2025 Christmas episode comes just over a year after she stopped by Studio 8H for Season 50.
Cher will be the musical guest.

title: Are Mindy and Alfie a 'Thing' in 'Emily in Paris' Season 5? Ashley Park Weighs In
summary: The "Emily in Paris" Season 5 trailer shows a steamy moment between Alfie and Mindy. What does star Ashley Park say about the moment?
story: The "Emily in Paris" Season 5 trailer finds Emily Cooper lucky in love in Rome, and leaves viewers wondering if her bestie Mindy Chen is also exploring a new, albeit unexpected, romance in the Eternal City.

Early on in the trailer, Mindy, played by Ashley Park, can be seen dining out with Alfie (Lucien Laviscount), Emily's ex. Then things appear to heat up as the pair dances and almost locks lips later on in the short clip.

While interviewing stars Park and Lily Collins in Venice for a segment that airs on Dec. 15, TODAY lifestyle contributor Jill Martin asked about what's going on between Alfie and Mindy, who broke up with her boyfriend Nicolas (Paul Forman) at the end of Season 4.
"Ashley, it looks like in the trailer you're about to make out with him," Martin noted during their chat.
"What made you think we were about to make out?" Park asked mischievously.
"It was very close," Martin replied.

Viewers will have to wait until Season 5 premieres on Netflix on Dec. 18 to find out if Mindy and Alfie are romantically involved — — and how Emily would react to such a pairing. But Park offered up the following teaser in the meantime:
"I also think they have a great friendship, and that's what we see," she said, adding that the pair was dancing, so it was natural that they'd be physically close together.
"There's heat," Collins, who plays Emily, added.
"Hot dancing," Park said.
What Happened Between Emily and Alfie?

Alfie first appeared in Season 2 of "Emily in Paris" when he met Emily during a French class. The pair didn't bond right away, but they soon found common ground over being expats in Paris (Alfie is from London).

Romance quickly blossomed, and the couple seemed to really be hitting it off. Soon, they had to decide whether they were up for a long-distance romance when Alfie announced that he had to return to London for work.
Alfie ended up staying in Paris when he found work with Antoine (William Abadie). Since his relationship with Emily was a bit rocky, he didn't tell her he was staying right away.
Emily and Alfie gave things another go but ended up breaking up at the end of Season 3 after Camille (Camille Razat) and Gabriel's (Lucas Bravo) failed wedding.
During the ceremony, Camille said she couldn't marry Gabriel because he's in love with Emily. It was too much for Alfie to handle and he said he didn't want to be Emily's second choice.

In Season 4, Emily and Alfie considered getting back together but she ended up pursuing a relationship with Gabriel. When they broke up, Emily ran into Alfie and was devastated to hear that he had a new girlfriend. Later on, Emily started dating an Italian man named Marcello (Eugenio Franceschini).

title: Taylor Swift Shares Her Four-Step ‘Wind Down’ Routine After Performing the ‘Eras Tour’
summary: Taylor Swift is sharing details about the routine that helped her relax after every "Eras Tour" concert
story: Taylor Swift is sharing details about the routine that helped her relax after every "Eras Tour" concert.
At the end of the first episode of her new "End of an Era" docuseries, the singer gave viewers an inside look into how she gets out of performance mode — and it starts with drawing a bath.
Swift, who turns 36 on Dec. 13, elaborated on the routine in an interview with Stephen Colbert on its Dec. 10 episode.
The singer said she feels like a "flickering lightbulb" after every concert, which ran for more than three hours and featured upwards of 44 songs.
"I'll go back to the hotel, get out of the costume, into the bath — — immediately — into the bath," Swift said, calling it her special "mermaid time."
Next, comes food and lots of it, Swift said.
"I get the most amount of room service possible," the singer joked.
"French fries? What's the go-to?" Colbert asked.
"Yes, everything," she replied. "Everything that I want on that given night."
Swift would also sign "2,000 CDs" or so after shows because doing "tactile hand activity" helped her to mentally decompress.
"It's like when I'm doing bread stuff," she said, referring to her highly publicized habit of baking sourdough loaves for loved ones.
"My kind of 'profession,'" Swift added, putting air quotes around the word, "is coming up with ideas for stuff. So if I can turn off the ideas for a second — very exciting."
Finally, she said she typically turns on the television to watch a favorite show.
"I'll put on my 'Dateline,' do you know what I mean?" she said, prompting the audience to laugh.
When Colbert asked her about reading, Swift said she is "constantly" listening to audiobooks.
When the host asked for favorite reads, Swift instead described the "elements" of what she looks for in a book.
Swift first name-checked Daphne du Maurier's classic gothic mystery "Rebecca" as an example of a book that might intrigue her.

"If you've got like an old rambling shambles, old British mansion covered in moss or ivy, and there's a mysterious relationship and he may not be what he seems," she said as Colbert’s audience began laughing.
"And there's been a murder that has happened in the past but there's the idea of a ghost or an actual ghost," she continued.

Swift went on to hilariously describe two other book ideas that would pull her in as the audience kept laughing. One centered around a "mysterious" family living "off the coast of Maine," and the other concerned a marriage that "isn't what it seems" –— preferably told by an "unreliable narrator."
"If you've got any of that, I'm going to need to read that," she said, "and when I say read that, I am going to need someone to read that to me."

Swift's record-breaking "Eras Tour" took her all over the globe from March 2023 until its final concert in Vancouver, Canada, on Dec. 8, 2024. The tour was chronicled in her new docuseries, "Taylor Swift: The End of an Era,” which premiered Dec. 12. Two new episodes will drop Dec. 19 before the finale airs Dec. 26.

title: What Time Is 'Landman' On? How to Watch Season 2, Episode 5
summary: When does the new episode of Landman come out? Here's how to watch Season 2, Episode 5 of Landman on Paramount+.
story: Ever since "Landman" Season 2 premiered on Nov. 16, the Paramount+ series has been breaking streaming records.
The season premiere alone brought in 9.2 million global streaming views in its first two days, which made it the most watched premiere in Paramount+ history.
Now that Season 2 is halfway through, viewers are holding their breath to see what happens next.
Eager to tune in to Episode 5? Here's everything you need to know.
What Time Does Episode 5 of 'Landman' Premiere?
New episodes of "Landman" premiere exclusively on Paramount+ on Sundays.
Season 2, Episode 5 of "Landman" lands on Paramount+ at 12 a.m. ET on Sunday, Dec. 14.
What Will Happen in Episode 5?
Season 2 Episode 5 finds Tommy (Billy Bob Thornton) navigating several issues, including Cami's (Demi Moore) lawsuit and an accident on M-Text Land.
On a more positive note, Angela (Ali Larter) hosts a dinner to welcome T.L. (Sam Elliott).
Is 'Landman' Renewed for Season 3?
"Landman" viewers got an early Christmas present on Dec. 5 when Paramount announced that the series had been renewed for a third season.
The series is set in West Texas and follows roughnecks and billionaires navigating an oil boom.

title: Taylor Swift Bleeped Out the Exact Bonus She Gave Dancers in Docuseries. The Number Left Them in Tears
summary: Taylor Swift's hefty bonuses to her "Eras Tour" dancers and crew members led to tears and shock, based on new footage from docuseries "End of an Era."
story: Taylor Swift's hefty bonuses to her "Eras Tour" employees have made plenty of headlines.
Now, fans can see for themselves how the singer's backup dancers reacted when Swift personally presented them with bonus checks.
In an emotional scene from Episode 2 of the Disney+ docuseries, "The End of an Era," Swift gathers with her dancers as they hold unopened handwritten thank you letters from her.
After telling the dancers how much she appreciates their "hard work," Swift asks one of the them, Kameron Saunders, to read his letter aloud.
"Dearest Kam, we've traveled the world like we set out to do. We dazzled the crowds but we've missed family, too," Saunders reads.
"My full gratitude doesn't come from a bank, but here's — " Saunders adds before pausing to catch his breath after seeing the dollar amount of his bonus.
Saunders then finishes reading Swift's message aloud, but the docuseries censors the exact figure with a bleep.
Saunders' fellow dancers hold their hands over their eyes and mouths in shock. Some visibly cry.
Later, Swift is seen embracing the tearful dancers. "We love you so much. This is crazy," one of them tells her.

While the exact bonus amount each dancer and crew member received is unknown, it's safe to say it was a hefty amount. As some viewers online have noticed, the censored number took several seconds to say aloud. And a few have tried reading Saunders' lips to determine what the shocking figure might have been.

Overall, Swift handed out $197 million in bonuses over the course of the tour to her "Eras Tour" employees, including dancers, band members, instrument techs, hair and makeup artists, wardrobe stylists, choreographers, security personnel, truck drivers, merchandise team members, caterers, videographers, pyrotechnics techs and riggers, lighting and sound techs, production staff and assistants, carpenters and physical therapists, People reported.
After completing the American leg of her tour in August 2023, the “Lover” singer surprised her truck drivers with $100,000 bonuses.

“Her father was the one that actually presented the checks to our drivers,” Shomotion trucking company CEO Mike Scherkenbach told TODAY at the time. “And he presented handwritten letters from Taylor. It’s incredible that they would take that time, and what it means to our staff to be recognized.”
The record-breaking tour spanned the globe from March 2023 until its final concert in Vancouver, Canada, on Dec. 8, 2024.
The tour grossed more than $2 billion in tickets, which is double the gross sales of any other concert tour in history, Swift’s production company confirmed to The New York Times.
The $2 billion figure does not include the tour's merchandise sales, the Times reported.
In the documentary, Swift explained: "If the tour grosses more, the bonuses are more."

title: Lily Collins Explains Why Emily Has a Bob in 'Emily in Paris' Season 5
summary: Lily Collins has a bob in Emily in Paris Season 5. Why did Lily, and therefore Emily, cut their hair so short? Inside the style decision.
story: New city, new hairstyle. Season 5 of "Emily in Paris" has many changes in store for its chipper American protagonist, played by Lily Collins.
TODAY lifestyle contributor Jill Martin ventured to Venice to chat about Season 5 with Collins and her onscreen and real life friend, Ashley Park, who plays Mindy.
Among the topics of their talk? What inspired the sudden strand switch-up for Collins' character.
"So did Emily get the bob, or did Lily get the bob?" Martin asked in a segment that will air on TODAY on Dec. 15.

"Lily got the bob," Collins clarified. "Usually Lily gets the haircuts first, and then Marylin (Fitoussi, the show's costume designer) is inspired by the haircuts to create the new wardrobe for the next season. And then I always go to Darren (Star, the show's creator) and I'm like, 'Hey, can I keep it?'"

Throughout the series, which returns for Season 5 on Dec. 18, Emily has rarely strayed from her signature long, brunette locks. Except, of course, that time she decided to cut her own bangs in the Season 3 premiere.
As it turns out, this was another case of art imitating life for Collins.
"In the season with the bangs, we created part of the storyline, you know, Ashley coming in, and being like, 'No!'" the actor said.
"Trauma bangs," Park noted.

Collins' real-life bob was a bit more of a dramatic mane move than getting bangs. She told Jill it's a style she wouldn't have considered sporting earlier in her life. But her hairstylist, Gregory Russell, convinced her to try it, since he'd always wanted to see her with shorter hair.

“I really love changing my hair, which is ironic, because growing up, I was like, ‘I never want to cut or color my hair.’ And so I did it, and I didn’t know how people would react. I was like, ‘Is there going to have to be a wig next season or whatever?'" she recalled.
Luckily, Star was down to keep the hairstyle, and the duo proceeded to debate if they should write it into the show.

“And I was like, ‘Well, we already did that with the bangs.’ So there was one moment, I believe it was cut (from the show) but there was a moment in the very first episode when I go into the Rome office and I sit down. Philippine (Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, who plays Sylvie) comes in, and the first thing she says is, ‘You cut your hair.’ And I said, ‘Oh, thanks.’ And she’s like, ‘It’s not a compliment. We’ve gotta go,’” she remembered.
Park wanted to make sure the merits of Collins' haircut were acknowledged so she improvised a bit while filming.

“I added a line. Because when Mindy comes to Rome, I remember being like, ‘Wait, hold up. I know that Lily got this haircut, but I feel like Mindy would at least be, like, ‘Love your hair!’” she said.

Martin was also curious to know if becoming a mother inspired Collins' new shorter hairstyle. In January 2025, Collins announced that she had welcomed her first child with her husband Charlie McDowell.
"No, it didn’t. I always wanted to do it. I had a very short haircut when I was 25 and then it grew out. But then I just kept it growing. No, it is more practical, perhaps," she said.
Regardless of her motivation for chopping her hair, the end result is fabulous, if you ask Park.
"I've never met anybody who could pull off, truly, any hairstyle, any hair color," she said.

title: Martha Stewart Confuses Nation With Unhinged Bagel-Eating Technique
summary: Taught years ago by her daughter Alexis, Martha Stewart explains her unconventional method for consuming the New York staple in an Instagram post.
story: Some people eat their bagel like a sandwich.
Others like to enjoy it in an open-faced capacity.
Martha Stewart does neither of those things.
“Taught years ago by my daughter Alexis Stewart,” she explained her unconventional method for consuming the New York staple in a Dec. 12 Instagram post.
She buys a poppy seed bagel from PopUp Bagels, a Connecticut-founded bagel chain known for its “rip and dip” experience.
She cuts it in half.
She takes a half of a half (aka a quarter) and breaks it into “sweet little pieces.”
She tops those “sweet little pieces” with a “modicum” of flavored or unflavored cream cheese.
This experience, she says, leaves her “always satisfied” and “never too full.”
Here’s what those “sweet little pieces” look like:
So, obviously, we have a lot of questions.
First off, and most urgently, what is going on here?
Second, why is she only eating a quarter of a bagel? Where does the rest go?
Third, why is she not ripping and dipping them as she eats?
Fourth, where does the lemon come into play?
Fifth, is this a self-induced schmear campaign?
And finally, how does PopUp Bagels feel about the way their bagel was treated?

“PopUp Bagels is known for eating bagels a little differently — Grip, Rip and Dip style. That being said, we encourage everyone to enjoy their bagel however they want, which is why we sell them hot and whole,” founder Adam Goldberg tells TODAY.com. “Martha just took that idea to a whole new level, and we love seeing all the creative ways people make it their own.”
Unsurprisingly, her comments section is filled with concerned citizens.
“Love you Martha but it’s 2025 we can eat whole bagels now ❤️,” wrote cookbook author Christina Musgrave, echoing other commenters’ “diet culture” sentiments.
“Idk about this one, diva,” commented another fan.
“This is unhinged, Martha,” wrote someone else.
“Straight to jail,” said another.
“Queen Martha, this is a violation of the bagel code of ethics 🚫,” one person warned.
“As a New Yorker, I’m against this nonsense,” wrote one more.
But perhaps, in tearing her bagel to shreds, she has actually found a way to unite the internet. Thank you, Martha, for your sacrifice.

title: You’ll Never Believe What Taylor Swift Wore For the First Day of ‘Eras Tour’ Rehearsal
summary: All along there really may have been some invisible string between Taylor Swift and her fiancé, Travis Kelce.
story: All along there really may have been some invisible string between Taylor Swift and her fiancé, Travis Kelce.

Opening night for her “Eras Tour” occurred on March 17, 2023, in Arizona, but as revealed in Swift’s new docuseries, “The End of an Era,” physical preparation for it started six months before her rehearsals.
So Swift is hopefully forgiven for what she wore the first day of rehearsals.
Per footage in the first episode of “The End of an Era,” Swift arrived to the first rehearsal of the tour wearing a grey Philadelphia Eagles sweatshirt.
The Eagles are one of the Kansas City Chiefs known rivals in recent sports history, having met at the Super Bowl in 2023 and again in 2025.
Swift and Kelce, tight end for the Kansas City Chiefs, have been dating since at least September 2023, when she appeared at Arrowhead Stadium for a game against the Chicago Bears.

But the “Eras Tour” — and all the preparation required for it — massively predates their relationship. (In fact, Kelce attending the “Eras Tour” in July 2023 led to them meeting in the first place, after a missed friendship bracelet connection.)

Before she started dating Kelce, Swift, who was born in Pennsylvania, had previously alluded to her love of the Philly team. In her 2020 song “Gold Rush,” she briefly sings about her “Eagles T-shirt hanging from the door.” Then, amid speculation that the lyric could refer to the team or the “Hotel California” band, Swift said onstage in Philadelphia in May 2023, “Guys, like, c’mon. I’m from Philly. Of course it’s the team.”
In the docuseries, Swift is seen wearing an Eagles sweatshirt in multiple clips from that rehearsal.

As she arrived at the rehearsal space, she already had tears in her eyes. While shaking the hand of one of her fellow performers, she said, “I’m weirdly emotional right now. It’s so nice to meet you, I’m Taylor.”
“I’ve never seen the boss come into rehearsal crying with tears of happiness and passion about their job,” dancer Whyley Yoshimura said about the moment.

The “Eras Tour” went on to kick off just weeks after her then-beloved Eagles lost to the Chiefs in the Super Bowl. That matchup made headlines for being the first Super Bowl to see two brothers — you guessed it, Travis and his brother, Jason Kelce — face off on opposing teams.
Unfortunately for Philly fans, by the 2025 Super Bowl, when the Eagles got their revenge and defeated the Chiefs 40-22, Swift had already switched allegiances, proudly supporting Travis Kelce.
Regarding football, she has since said, “The whole season I am locked in on what that man is doing on the field.”
Jason Kelce, Travis Kelce’s brother and former Philadelphia Eagles center, has yet to comment on the sweatshirt’s appearance.

title: Hockey Drama ‘Heated Rivalry’ Renewed for Second Season
summary: "Heated Rivalry" has been picked up for Season 2 as the Canadian hockey romance has become a global sensation
story: "Heated Rivalry" has been picked up for Season 2 as the Canadian hockey romance has become a global sensation.

Created by Jacob Tierney and based on the 2019 romance book by Rachel Reid, "Heated Rivalry" follows the love story between two rival hockey players over the span of eight years, from becoming rookies to playing in the Olympics.

“Watching our show become an international phenomenon has been extraordinary. We’re profoundly grateful to everyone that has been on this journey with us. Being renewed for a second season so early is a true honor, and we can’t wait to bring you even more of what you love,” Tierney and executive producer Brendan Brady said in a statement.
The show's renewal comes the same day as the release of Episode 4, titled "Rose." The series has two more episodes to go, culminating in a Dec. 26 finale.

The six-episode series, which was produced by Canadian streaming platform Crave, is currently airing in the U.S. and Australia on HBO Max. The smutty show soared to the streamer's top 10 TV shows list within a week of its two-episode premiere on Nov. 28.

"Heated Rivalry" has so far closely followed the events of Reid's book of the same name, and the sixth episode of the series, which is named "The Cottage," is expected to align with the novel's final act.

Luckily for fans of the story, Shane (Hudson Williams) and Ilya's (Connor Storrie) story continues in Reid's 2022 sequel called "The Long Game." Both books are part of her hockey romance series, "Game Changers."
Reid previously hinted at the show's renewal in an interview with TODAY.com. She also discussed if she'd ever revisit Shane and Ilya's story again.
"I have story ideas for them that I’ve been working on," she said. "They never leave my head."
"Some of them I’m working on, I’m trying to figure out what to do with them, but there’s going to be something," she added. "You’ll see something for sure."

title: Who Was the Killer in ‘Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery’? The Ending Explained
summary: Find out how Daniel Craig's Benoit Blanc pieces together the clues to solve the murder in “Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery,” and how the film’s clever title comes to fruition.
story: Warning: Spoilers from “Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery.”
Benoit Blanc has stumbled into a contemptuous congregation hiding a murderous secret in his latest whodunnit, “Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery.”
Set in a small upstate New York town, the third installment in the “Knives Out” franchise from director and writer Rian Johnson tackles religion, false prophets and, of course, a complicated murder.

The film — now streaming on Netflix — is mostly told through the perspective of a young priest named Jud, played by Josh O’Connor, who is sent to help run a modest parish led by Monsignor Jefferson Wicks, portrayed by Josh Brolin. After meeting Wicks and developing a strained dynamic with him, he also meets the monsignor’s loyal congregation: Wicks’ right-hand woman Martha (Glenn Close), doctor Nat (Jeremy Renner), lawyer Vera (Kerry Washington) struggling author Lee (Andrew Scott), chronically ill concert cellist Simone (Cailee Spaeny), failed politician Cy (Daryl McCormack) and groundskeeper Samson (Thomas Haden Church).

During one service, the monsignor delivers a disparaging and chaotic homily, his speciality, before stepping into a compact side room to collect himself while Jud briefly takes over. Seconds later, Jud and the churchgoers hear a loud thud before finding Wicks lying on the ground, dead. Baffled by how the murderer pulled off their plan, local police chief Geraldine (Mila Kunis) enlists the help of renowned detective Benoit Blanc, played by Daniel Craig, to unravel the case.

Compared to the previous films, “Wake Up Dead Man” has a darker tone and more violence. Johnson tells TODAY.com that he wanted to “ground” the third movie and its themes in a subject that was “very personal for me.”

“I grew up very Christian. I’m not a believer anymore, but it’s something I have a lot of complicated feelings about,” he shares.  “So the challenge of seeing if we can make a big, entertaining, fun whodunnit and at the same time, in a complicated and generous way — not just a finger wagging way — look at those issues of faith and Christianity in America right now.”
He adds, “That seemed like a worthy challenge.”

A big reason he was able to pull it off: Craig’s portrayal of Blanc. Johnson says that the actor’s performance, while hilarious and captivating, is rooted in basic human decency and empathy. He also notes that in each of his “Knives Out” movies he has paired Blanc with a good-hearted protagonist who anchors the film. For “Wake Up Dead Man” the relationship between Blanc, a nonbeliever, and O’Connor’s Jud, a devoted priest, is at the center of the movie.
Johnson reveals that Jud was the most difficult character to pin down when he worked on the script because of his arc.
“I hope the movie lands in an emotionally satisfying place for the audience…that was definitely the biggest challenge. But I feel really, really proud of the result,” he says.

Each film in the “Knives Out” franchise is named after a song. Johnson teases that “Wake Up Dead Man,” the title of a 1997 U2 song from the band’s album “Pop” that is always playing in his head, fit perfectly for the flick’s unexpected twist.
“For reasons that’ll become more clear once you see the movie, it makes a lot of sense for this film,” he shares.
Read on to find out how Blanc pieces together the clues to solve “Wake Up Dead Man,” and how the film’s clever title comes to fruition.
How Does ‘Wake Up Dead Man’ End?

“Wake Up Dead Man” includes the most on-screen deaths in the “Knives Out” franchise, as Wicks isn’t the only character who is brutally murdered. During a stormy night, the Wicks family tomb, where the monsignor was buried, miraculously opens from the inside and a man resembling Wicks emerges. (Hence the movie’s title.) The revived man then follows a hooded figure into the woods. Jud, watching from afar, goes after the two of them. He is knocked unconscious and awakens to find Samson impaled with a garden hook. Meanwhile, another hooded figure is seen meeting with Nat at his home in the middle of the night.

Blanc discovers a disheveled Jud, who believes he is responsible for Samson’s murder and needs to confess. But before Jud can turn himself in to Geraldine, he and Blanc travel to Nat’s home. There, they find the doctor’s body disintegrated in a tub filled with toxic chemicals, leaving only his bones.

Overcome by guilt, Jud goes to speak to Geraldine. As he tries to confess, Blanc interrupts him and reveals to Jud, Geraldine and the rest of the monsignor’s followers that he knows who the killer is.

The detective explains in his delightful Southern accent that the monsignor collapsed after drinking a poisoned flask following his homily. He says that when the rest of the congregation joined Jud to investigate the body, the killer’s accomplice, Nat, secretly stabbed Wicks, who was already dead.

While relaying the evidence, Blanc abruptly pauses and says he cannot continue. He’d prefer the culprit admit their sins. After most of the congregation leaves the church, Martha remains and confirms she is the killer. She recalls that when she was a little girl, Wicks’ father, Prentice, swallowed his family’s inheritance — a rare jewel — prior to his death to prevent his children and the church from becoming corrupted by greed. She was the only one who knew the truth about the location of the jewel and chose to keep it to herself for decades.

But when Jud arrived at the parish, she decided to share her secret with the monsignor during confession. She instantly realized she had made a mistake and plotted to kill Wicks so he couldn’t get the jewel. She teamed up with Nat, since he had access to drugs they could use to spike Wicks’ flask. Their convoluted plan also contained another crucial step: they removed Wicks’ body from his coffin and instead Samson, Martha’s husband, would take his place. The switch allowed the groundskeeper to remove the jewel from Prentice’s corpse and lie in the casket until he received a signal. Then, he would perform the “miracle” of exiting the Wicks tomb, bringing more parishioners and prestige to the church.

However, the plan went awry when Samson met with Nat in the woods after leaving the tomb. Nat stabbed Samson with the garden tool and stole the jewel. Martha discovered Nat’s betrayal, went to his home, inconspicuously snatched the jewel and pushed the doctor into the toxic tub, killing him.
After revealing how she pulled off her crimes, Martha dies in Jud and Blanc’s arms, as she willingly ingested the same poison Wicks drank.
While chatting to TODAY.com about the killer’s reveal, Kerry Washington, whose character is one of the few that has a happy ending, says she didn’t see it coming when she first read the script.
“There’s no way when I got to the end that I would have been able to guess it,” she says. “I tried while I was reading it, and I just never would have.”

title: Beans and Labneh: Salma Hayek Pinault’s Cooking Is ‘Eclectic’ Thanks to Lebanese-Mexican Roots
summary: Salma Hayek Pinault talks about what she ate growing up, like labneh and black beans, with Lebanese, Mexican and Spanish cooking all under the same roof.
story: Salma Hayek Pinault recalls when her mother used to make labneh.

“You would see the cloth hanging in my kitchen,” she tells TODAY.com, explaining the process of making the thick and creamy Middle Eastern strained yogurt. “In my house, sometimes you would put labneh into the beans; it was like a mixture.”
The Kahlua spokesperson says her childhood was defined by the cuisines of both of her father, Sami Hayek Dominguez, and her mother, Diana Jiménez Medina.

“Maybe that’s why I can be very eclectic when I’m cooking and have a lot of imagination, because my mom, her family is from Spain, but we lived in Mexico, and my father is from Lebanon,” she says. “Spanish cuisine is also very, very diverse. Her father was from the south of Spain, and my grandmother from the north and so they’re two completely different cuisines. We had all the Mexican dishes, all the Spanish dishes and all the Lebanese dishes in that house.”

Following in her mother’s culinary footsteps, Hayek Pinault is known to make a mean guacamole, and her “favorite thing is to come up with recipes in the moment.” she says. “Just in the kitchen, whatever is left, how do I transform it? How do I make something?”
And her least favorite thing? “Wasting food,” she says.

Hayek Pinault recalls recently making an oven-roasted chicken, which became a spicy chicken dish the next day, which was then stuffed into a quesadilla the day after that for her daughter, Valentina, and her friends.

“I made the chicken very small, kind of like a tinga, but it was more tasty and spicy and with a little bit of chipotle, and then I melted the cheese and beans,” she says. “It was very successful, I have to say.”

title: When Do New Episodes of 'Heated Rivalry' Come Out? What to Know About the Steamy Hockey Drama
summary: 'Heated Rivalry' is streaming on HBO Max with new episodes released weekly. Here's how to watch the series and the full release schedule.
story: HBO Max’s newest series has viewers buzzing. “Heated Rivalry,” a romantic drama inspired by Rachel Reid’s book series “Game Changers,” dropped its first two episodes on the streaming service on Nov. 28 and left viewers wanting more.

The TV series follows two rival hockey players, Canadian Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) and Russian Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie), as they navigate their professional lives and mix business with pleasure.
Curious to know what all the fuss is about? Here’s everything you need to know about “Heated Rivalry” and how to watch the rest of the season.
When Do New Episodes of ‘Heated Rivalry’ Come Out? Here’s the Schedule
The first two episodes of “Heated Rivalry”premiered on HBO Max on Nov. 28.
Additional episodes of the series will premiere each week through Dec. 26, 2025, when the finale airs.
Nov. 28: Episode 1, "Rookies"Nov. 28: Episode 2, "Olympians" Dec. 5: Episode 3, "Hunter"Dec. 12: Episode 4, "Rose"
Nov. 28: Episode 1, "Rookies"
Nov. 28: Episode 2, "Olympians"
Dec. 5: Episode 3, "Hunter"
Dec. 12: Episode 4, "Rose"
Dec. 19: Episode 5, “I’ll Believe in Anything”Dec. 26: Episode 6, “The Cottage”
Dec. 19: Episode 5, “I’ll Believe in Anything”
Dec. 26: Episode 6, “The Cottage”
Each new episode drops on HBO Max at 12 a.m. ET on Friday, or 9 p.m. PT Thursday.
Where to Watch ‘Heated Rivalry’
“Heated Rivalry” was originally created for the Canadian streaming service Crave.
The show is available to view in the U.S. and Australia on HBO Max.
What Is ‘Heated Rivalry’ About?
When hockey rivals Shane and Ilya meet each other as rookies, sparks fly. They embark on a secret fling that turns into a “years-long journey of love, denial and self-discovery,” per a press release.
“Heated Rivalry” follows Shane and Ilya over the course of eight years while they “chase glory on the ice while struggling to navigate their feelings off it.”
A trailer for the series alludes to the covert nature of the hockey players’ tryst as a woman asks Shane if there are “any gay hockey players.”
“None that have said it publicly,” he replies.
After hooking up with Ilya, Shane addresses him, saying, “So you’re not going to tell anyone about this, are you?”

Elsewhere in the trailer, Ilya tells a woman he isn’t seeing anyone and she notices that he’s been texting a woman named Jane “for years.” As it turns out, Jane is the name Ilya uses for Shane in his phone.

“Torn between the sport they live for and the love they can’t ignore, Shane and Ilya must decide if there is room in their fiercely competitive world for something as fragile and as powerful as real love,” the press release reads.

title: John Stamos Shares His Wife's NSFW Reaction to 'Hunting Wives' Casting, Leaving Craig Speechless
summary: John Stamos being cast in the second season of the Netflix hit "The Hunting Wives" begged an immediate question from his wife about how much of Stamos would be appearing on the show.
story: John Stamos being cast in the second season of the Netflix hit "The Hunting Wives" begged an immediate question from his wife about how much of Stamos would be appearing on the show.
The former "Full House" star shared wife Caitlin McHugh's blunt reaction to his casting on a show known for its racy sex scenes and wild dialogue, and it left Craig Melvin speechless on TODAY.
"I told my wife I was doing it, and she said, 'Are you going to show your penis?'" Stamos said.
Craig could only laugh as he clasped his hands, bowed his head and took a breath to compose his reaction.
"I said, ‘I don’t think so,'" Stamos continued. "But it’s one of those shows."
Stamos, former "The O.C." cast member Cam Gigandet and "Winter's Bone" actor Dale Dickey have joined the cast of the second season of "The Hunting Wives," Variety reported on Dec. 9.

The show stars Malin Akerman as the wildcat wife of an aspiring Texas politician and Brittany Snow as a Massachusetts transplant who gets entangled romantically and socially with Akerman’s Margo Banks.
Craig noted that full frontal nudity is not out of the question considering that Stamos hasn't seen the script yet for the second season of "The Hunting Wives."
"But if they asked you, you probably would," Craig said.
"Well, we’ll see," Stamos replied. "Would you?"
"No! No John, I need this job," Craig said.
"This is a morning show," Stamos responded.
"This is a morning show!" Craig said while laughing.

Stamos, 62, who also expressed his wife's trepidation about "The Hunting Wives" role in an appearance on "The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon" on Dec. 11, is currently starring in "Palm Royale" on Apple TV.
He plays doctor, lawyer and "part-time gynecologist" Dr. Dusty Magic on the fourth season of the comedy-drama starring Kristen Wiig.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Engagement Retold in New Children’s Picture Book: See Inside
summary: The upcoming children's book, “Taylor & Travis Forever Ultimate Fan Edition Little Golden Book Biography” will let readers learn all about their engagement.
story: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s storybook romance is getting the storybook treatment.
The couple’s relationship and engagement will be chronicled in a new interactive children’s book called “Taylor & Travis Forever Ultimate Fan Edition Little Golden Book Biography.”

“Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are getting married!” reads a press release about the book. “Celebrate by reading an all-new illustrated biography about everyone’s favorite couple and then use your imagination to plan their wedding by writing in your ideas and drawing your designs on the interactive pages!

The couple announced their engagement in August, setting off a fan frenzy. The book, written by Nicole de las Heras and illustrated by Elisa Charvarri, promises to delve into both of their lives, as well as the connection they share.

“Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce fans of all ages will enjoy reading about the stars’ lives before and after falling in love. Both were born in the same year, both enjoy close bonds with their brothers, and both achieved success thanks to their supportive families—and their incredible talent,” reads the release.

“And because no fairy-tale is complete without a wedding, readers can help plan the big day with interactive pages to write in, draw, and imagine what Taylor and Travis’s celebration will be like. The guest list, the dress, the cake, whether the cats are coming, it’s all up to you! Includes a page of Taylor stickers to use any way you’d like!”
“Taylor & Travis Forever Ultimate Fan Edition Little Golden Book Biography” will be available to buy March 24, 2026.

Swift and Kelce are no strangers to having their courtship appear in a children’s book. The 2024 book “The Kelce Brothers: A Little Golden Book Biography” focused on Travis Kelce and his brother, Jason Kelce, but also featured the pop star and discussed her relationship with Travis Kelce.

title: Are You a Faithful or Traitor? Find Out in a NYC 'The Traitors' Experience
summary: “The Traitors” fans will soon have a chance to experience the hit reality show in real life and see if they can be an honest Faithful or a murderous Traitor.
story: “The Traitors” fans will soon have a chance to experience the hit reality show in real life and see if they can be an honest Faithful or a murderous Traitor.

An activation based on the Peacock series is heading to the East Coast next month after previously popping up in Los Angeles earlier this year. This time, “The Traitors Experience” is taking place in New York City, where fans will compete in intense missions while also deceiving one other.

The immersive experience will be held inside a storied 1875 Brooklyn landmark, Peacock revealed in a press release. The game will be open to the public starting Wednesday, Jan. 14 and will be played in one-hour cycles.

“Friends and strangers alike will face a series of pulse-pounding missions: an exhilarating game of deceit and deception in a candlelit lounge, a puzzle-filled rummage through Alan Cumming’s iconic wardrobe, and a dramatic finale around the legendary Round Table, all within a 60-minute multi-sensory journey,” Peacock explained in a press release.

When fans arrive, at least one member of their group will be tapped to be a Traitor, just like on the show. It will be up to the Faithfuls to piece together clues and figure out the identity of the Traitor.

“The Traitors Experience” will run from Jan. 14 until Thursday, Jan. 22, at the Weylin event venue in Brooklyn, New York. Fans will have to purchase tickets for $40 each, plus fees, to participate. Ticket reservations can be booked HERE.

The return of the interactive experience coincides with the upcoming premiere of “The Traitors.” The first three episodes of Season 4 will arrive on Peacock Jan. 8 at 6 p.m. PT/ 9 p.m. ET. The next two episodes will be available the following week on Jan. 15. Then, a new episode will be released weekly leading to a finale and reunion event on Feb. 26.

title: Meet the 13-Year-Old Who Says She's Taylor Swift's Top Listener on Spotify
summary: A 13-year-old from Pittsburgh has come forward as Taylor Swift’s top listener on Spotify this year. She explained how it happened in a TODAY.com interview.
story: Emma Wood knew her Spotify Wrapped, an annual tradition that synthesizes users’ listening habits, would be full of Taylor Swift.

What the 13-year-old didn’t expect, however, was being crowned the platform’s top listener of the artist — quite a feat, considering Swift has over 100 million listeners on Spotify and was the second most-streamed artist of 2025, behind only Bad Bunny.
She learned of her No. 1 status through Spotify Wrapped's new Fan Leaderboard feature.

“Think you’re one of your top artist’s biggest fans? This year, you might see where you rank among their listeners worldwide, based on your total minutes listened,” an announcement on Spotify’s website reads.
According to screenshots and screen recordings of Wood’s Spotify Wrapped, she is Swift’s No. 1 listener. Spotify declined to comment for this story.

Wood personally amassed a total of 449,000 minutes listened to Swift, which Spotify equated to 312 days. Most of her minutes are from enjoying her favorite song, “The Albatross,” from Swift’s 2024 album “The Tortured Poets Department,” which she streamed 83,601 times in 2024. (Her TikTok username, @thealbatrosswife, points to the obsession).
Wood says she was shocked when she saw the numbers.
“I didn’t think that it was going to be that high,” Wood tells TODAY.com. “I thought it was going to be, like, maybe 12,000 or something.”
“At first, I was like, ‘Is my Spotify glitching?’” she adds.

On Dec. 4, Wood shared her Spotify listening feat on TikTok. The video, with over 10 million views, showed screenshotted proof of Wood’s top listener title as she reacted in shock, writing on the video: “Before you ask YES I have a therapist.”
Wood’s video amassed reactions — and skepticism. Wood followed up with another video of her scrolling through her Spotify Wrapped results on her mom’s phone, to prove her case.
Before you ask: Yes, Wood does listen to Swift while she sleeps, which helped rack up her dayslong minutes-listened number.
Wood says she listens to music when she falls asleep because she “can’t sleep otherwise.” It’s a habit that dates back to a sweet childhood memory.
“When I was little, and I couldn’t fall asleep, my dad would just play a song from his band, and I would be asleep,” she says.
Instead of hearing her dad play a song, now she falls asleep to Swift.

Wood says she never gets sick of “The Albatross” — even on the 83,601st listen. “The Albatross” plays on the legend of the albatross, a seabird said to bring bad luck to sailors and is now associated with burdens. Swift likens the albatross to a person, or more specifically “a woman, here to destroy you.”
For her, this 2024 song is a background song she can play while relaxing or scrolling online, and it’s also a song she can tune her full attention to when she wants to belt the lyrics.
“I don’t think there’s another song that I could actually like listen to that makes me feel that way,” she says. “It really is kind of just like a comfort song.”

Wood explains how music, particularly Swift’s, plays a large role in her mental health. Last year, Wood says she “was not doing the best mentally,” and while feeling down, she remembers turning on this song for the first time.
“So just having a song that I really just look back and I’m like, ‘This song has been with me through some of the hardest times and some of the easiest times of my life,’” she says.
Wood’s mother, Monica, attested to how much Swift has truly impacted her daughter.
“I saw a complete turnaround in Emma. She went from depressed to extremely happy,” Monica told TODAY.com. “I never realized how much Taylor Swift meant to Emma until this happened,” she adds.
“I never knew how much Taylor was helping her through music. Taylor’s music is Emma’s therapy,” she adds.

“It’s just so crazy to think like there was once an 11-year-old girl who was scared to even go to school, like literally just waiting for the ‘Tortured Poets Department’ to come out and now there’s a 13-year-old girl who can’t go a day without listening to it,” Wood says.
Through all the viral videos and the continuous streaming, Wood says she has so much to tell Swift if given the chance.

“I would just say thank you so much for being the person that you are and being my comfort artist in so many different ways,” she says. “You don’t even know I exist, but thank you for understanding me.”
“I would love to meet her one day, I really would,” Wood adds.

title: When and What Time Is ‘F1 The Movie’ Streaming on Apple TV?
summary: When and what time to watch “F1 The Movie” on Apple TV after it dominated theaters over the summer.
story: After dominating the box office this summer, “F1 The Movie” is making its way from IMAX theaters to a screen near you.

The sports film, starring Brad Pitt, Damson Idris and Javier Bardem, hit theaters in June and became an instant success, racking up over $630 million worldwide, according to Box Office Mojo. It is also the highest-grossing sports film of all time, Apple TV said in a press release.

“F1 The Movie,” directed by Joseph Kosinski and produced by Jerry Bruckheimer, tells the story of a Formula 1 driver named Sonny Hayes (Pitt) who was a star in the ‘90s with a promising career until he had a life-threatening accident on the track. Thirty years later, Ruben Cervantes, a friend and owner of a down-and-out Formula 1 team (Bardem), gets Sonny to return to racing, where he teams up with hotshot rookie Joshua (Idris).
Bruckheimer described the film as a “redemption story” and an “emotional journey” when speaking with TODAY.com earlier this year.
“It was a thrill to do,” he said.

The movie also featured real F1 drivers, including Lewis Hamilton, who served as a producer and adviser on the film, too. To make the movie even more realistic, Pitt and Idris were actually behind the wheel racing the cars.
“I can’t explain it. You have to be in it to feel it, you know? But the brilliance of this movie is, through watching it, you feel like you’re in a car,” Idris told TODAY.com.
Now, fans can experience that feeling again, or for the first time, when “F1: The Movie” hits streaming. Read on to find out how to watch, below.
When is ‘F1 The Movie’ Streaming?
“F1 The Movie” will be available to stream on Friday, Dec. 12.
Where is ‘F1 The Movie’ Streaming?
The film, produced by Apple Studios, will stream on Apple TV.
What Have the Director and Stars Said About ‘F1 The Movie’?
The creative team behind “F1 The Movie” and the stars went to great lengths to make sure the movie accurately depicted Formula 1 racing.
Speaking about preparing for the movie, Bruckheimer told TODAY.com, “Damson Idris, who’s a rising young star, had to drive in these cars and train for three months, just like Brad (Pitt) did.”
He added, “But the brutality of what you go through in these cars that are going 180 miles an hour — they have to break down to 50. They’re taking 5 Gs in the corners. It is brutal.”
He also shared that the movie was shot at nine of the 22 different tracks around the world as the plot includes the last nine races of the season.
Bruckheimer said the stars had to drive “these cars at high speeds in front of 140,000 people and 10 million people, 100 million people” while also “remembering your lines at the same time.”
For Bardem, seeing the shots come together made him appreciate the sport more.

“Being part of the scenes with the driver, and being part of what it means to be a team, and the whole structure of what it takes to put those drivers on the track, it’s so much work,” he told TODAY.com. “And it’s very admirable to see the effort that it takes for so many people to make that car ready to go that speed.”

title: Author Freida McFadden Responds to the Rumor That 'AI Is Writing Her Books'
summary: Freida McFadden shuts down rumors that Ai is writing her books and other rumors about her prolific career during an interview with Jenna Bush Hager.
story: Freida McFadden would like to set the record straight.
The bestselling author sat down with Jenna Bush Hager for an “Open Book with Jenna” podcast episode, which aired on Dec. 11, to discuss her double life as a thriller author and physician.

McFadden, who writes under a pseudonym, is notoriously prolific. “The Intruder,” her latest, came out in October, and she has another, “Dear Debbie,” coming in January. Meanwhile, an adaptation of McFadden’s novel “The Housemaid” starring Amanda Seyfried and Sydney Sweeney is out in December.
Her output, combined with her job as a medical professional, has people questioning whether McFadden uses artificial intelligence to write her books.
“I think every author gets the ‘AI is writing her books,’ even though most of (my books) are written before AI,” McFadden chuckled.
She then brought up other rumors about her. “One that is very funny is people saying I’m three men,” she said.
Jenna chimed in saying doubters probably “can’t imagine” it’s just one woman penning so many page-turners on her own.
“It’s sort of a compliment,” McFadden continued. “Like it will take three men to do what I actually do.”
She then shared what she thinks is the “funniest” rumor she’s heard about herself.

“I saw a post somebody made where somebody said that in my author photo, my cleavage is Photoshopped. The funniest part was that in the post, he said he discussed it with his wife and they had a whole conversation about how my cleavage was photoshopped and why,” she said.
The author continued, “I kind of love this couple ... this guy is like, ‘Hey honey, come over here, this is Photoshopped.’ And she’s like, ‘Let me take a look.’ So I love that for them.”
Elsewhere in the episode, McFadden touched on other aspects about her career, including why she has chosen to write under a pseudonym.
“I never for a moment considered not writing under a pen name. I just wanted to keep it separate,” McFadden explained.

“There’s something I also think I should mention, which is these books come from inside my brain. These are my personal thoughts, and it’s almost like when people are reading it, it’s like they’re reading my diary and it’s a little embarrassing. I don’t want them to know what I’m thinking, and now they all do.”

title: Is 'F1 The Movie' Based on a True Story?
summary: “F1 The Movie," starring Brad Pitt, opens June 27. Here's what to know about the Formula 1 racing movie, including whether it's based on a true story.
story: People can now enjoy “F1 The Movie” from the comfort of their home.
After its successful theatrical run over the summer, the sports drama is making its debut on Apple TV on Dec. 12.
The Formula 1-inspired film was first released in theaters on June 27, grossing over $630 million worldwide, according to Box Office Mojo.

The action-packed film, showcased the fast-paced and entertaining world of Formula 1 with Brad Pitt starring as Sonny Hayes, a former F1 driver from the ‘90s who had a promising career until an accident on the track nearly ended his life.

"F1 The Movie" follows Sonny 30 years later after his friend and owner of a struggling F1 team, Ruben Cervantes (Javier Bardem), convinces him to return to motorsport. But first, Sonny will have to put his and hotshot rookie Joshua Pearce's (Damson Idris) differences aside to work together and nab some wins.
“It was a thrill to do,” producer Jerry Bruckheimer tells TODAY.com, describing the film as an “emotional journey we take you on.”
“That’s what we love about this movie. It’s a redemption story.”

F1 has become more popular in the U.S. following the release of Netflix’s “Drive to Survive,” now in its seventh season. U.S. viewership of the motorsport is also growing. ESPN reported in September that F1 telecasts across ABC, ESPN and ESPN2 were averaging 1.4 million viewers, up after the all-time series record average of 1.21 million in 2022.
Now that the 2025 F1 season is over, Apple TV will be the one-stop shop for the 2026 season. Every Grand Prix will stream live all season in the U.S. starting March 7, 2026.
With more people getting into Formula 1, many are curious about the events in the film and if they are inspired by real-life people. Bruckheimer, director Joseph Kosinski and the cast break it down.
Is ‘F1 The Movie’ Based on a True Story?
No, “F1 The Movie” is not based on a true story.
However, Bruckheimer and Kosinski enlisted seven-time Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton as a producer and adviser to make the film as authentic as possible.
Did ‘F1 The Movie’ Film at Real Races?
Yes, “F1 The Movie” was filmed during real Grand Prix weekends during the 2023 and 2024 seasons.
Real F1 drivers from the 10 teams were also included in the film, as well as team principals like Ferrari’s Fred Vasseur and Mercedes’ Toto Wolff, among other notable figures.

According to Bruckheimer, the film crew built their own garage and six modified Formula 2 cars designed by Mercedes. Kosinski also noted that the team developed a camera system from scratch that was small enough to mount on the car to show the experience of what it feels like to drive one of the vehicles.
“We had track time at every race,” Bruckheimer says, explaining that they would get a couple of minutes in between qualifying or practice to film the fictional APXGP team with the other teams.

“What was exciting for our actors is, first of all, they’re driving these cars at high speeds in front of 140,000 people and ... 100 million people on television, nobody knew that Brad and Damson were driving these cars,” he adds. “Then we had the track when the teams weren’t there.”
Pitt also told TODAY during a surprise appearance at a New York screening about his experience driving the car.

“Our first scene was on the grid during race weekend at Silverstone (home of British Grand Prix events), where F1 started, and we were on the grid with the drivers,” he told Savannah Guthrie. “We got one take, and we’re moving on. And it just led to this great kind of energy you’ll see that I think shows on the screen.”

Calling the action “such a thrill,” he said, “It’s so hard to explain what these cars can do. We would be barreling down the straight at 180, and you think that’s something. But the fact that these cars can brake, can stop and make a complete right turn, it feels like the car is going to flip, and it sticks. It is unbelievable. It’s unbelievable what these drivers can do.”
Were Any Characters Inspired by Real F1 Figures?
No, most characters were created for the film. However, some actors drew inspiration from a number of people for their role.

Kerry Condon, who portrays Kate McKenna, the technical director for team APXGP, tells TODAY.com she drew inspiration from Bernie Collins, an F1 strategy analyst for Sky Sports and F1TV and former F1 strategy engineer for the Aston Martin F1 team.

“We did take a bit of an artistic license where I play a strategist in certain parts of the movie with the tires and stuff,” Condon says. “I was like, I’ll just do everything. But Bernie had a similar education to me, (went to an) all-girls school and stuff, so I kind of brought in a lot of my own background and made it my own.”
Bardem says Ruben was not inspired by anyone in particular, but more of “a mix of different team owners that I would meet or see on documentaries and and just put them together.”

title: Brooke Shields Lost Her Iconic Calvin Klein Jeans. Jenna Will Help Find Them — On 1 Condition
summary: Two pairs of some of the most iconic jeans in history are lost in the home of their owner, Brooke Shields.
story: Two pairs of some of the most iconic jeans in history are lost in the home of their owner, Brooke Shields.

Jenna Bush Hager is ready to help in the search for the legendary Calvin Kleins, but she had one request for the model, actor and entrepreneur during Shields’ Dec. 11 appearance as a guest co-host on Jenna & Friends.
As Jenna reminisced about previously working the Met Gala, she figured finding Shields’ jeans could be her ticket back to one of the most prestigious events in the fashion world.
“Here’s the deal,” she told Shields. “If I find the jeans at your house, I can go as your date.”
The two then shook on it.
“Deal,” Shields said. “I just have to get invited.”
Shields, 60, was first invited to the Met Gala in 1983, just three years after she starred in one of the most famous ad campaigns of all time.
She was a 15-year-old model in 1980 when she posed in Calvin Klein jeans and uttered the line, “You want to know what comes in between me and my Calvins? Nothing.”

The commercial was banned by some TV networks after causing an uproar by critics who labeled it sexually suggestive. The jeans worn by Shields in the ad campaign became so famous that one pair was put on display at the Met Gala.
“I had to give a pair of my Calvin Klein jeans to the Met, as one does,” Shields said. “It’s really ridiculous, but a pair of my jeans are in the Met.”
Shields had a surreal moment when she saw the jeans on display during the Met Gala one year.
“They pose the mannequin in the model pose that I was in, and the hair was all matted and weird,” Shields said. “It was very odd to walk through and see, like, me. But it was an honor.”
Jenna asked her whatever became of the famous jeans.

“I have two pairs, that I believe (are) in my possession,” Shields said. “I’ve had them on one hook for about, oh, I don’t know, nine years, and went to the hook yesterday and can’t find them. They’ll show up. My house is like a black hole, so they will show up.”
Shields said her mother “kept everything” from her career, including the jeans.
“She was like, ‘Trust me. One day,’” Shields said. “It’s a very odd thing, and the fact that I’m now a part of that history and to sort of still be here and be considered history, it’s an honor.”
Shields reflected on the controversial 1980 ad in a 2021 interview with Vogue.

“I didn’t think it was about underwear or sexual in nature,” Shields said. “What was shocking to me was to be berated by ‘Oh, you knew this was happening. This is what you thought. You were thinking these thoughts.’”
Shields returned to modeling for Calvin Klein in 2017 with a lingerie campaign. In 2022, she posed in jeans at 56 in an ad for Jordache.

title: Disney Strikes Deal With OpenAI To Let Sora Generate AI Videos of Its Characters
summary: It’s “A Whole New World.”The Walt Disney Company announced on Thursday that it had reached a three-year agreement with OpenAI to bring its popular characters to the company’s Sora AI video generator
story: It’s “A Whole New World.”
The Walt Disney Company announced on Thursday that it had reached a three-year agreement with OpenAI to bring its popular characters to the company’s Sora AI video generator.

Disney will also make a $1 billion investment in the ChatGPT owner. The company says it will also become a “major customer” of OpenAI, using its services to develop new products and experiences, including for its Disney+ streaming service.
“Under the agreement, Disney and OpenAI are affirming a shared commitment to the responsible use of AI that protects user safety and the rights of creators,” the companies said in a statement.
OpenAI also says it has committed to “implementing responsible measures to further address trust and safety, including age-appropriate policies.”

Disney says that some of the characters that are part of the deal include: Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Lilo, Stitch, Ariel, Belle, Beast, Cinderella, Baymax, Simba, Mufasa, as well as characters from the worlds of “Encanto,” “Frozen,” “Inside Out,” “Moana,” “Monsters Inc.,” “Toy Story,” “Up,” and “Zootopia.”

“Technological innovation has continually shaped the evolution of entertainment, bringing with it new ways to create and share great stories with the world,” Bob Iger, CEO of The Walt Disney Company, said in a news release.

“The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence marks an important moment for our industry, and through this collaboration with OpenAI we will thoughtfully and responsibly extend the reach of our storytelling through generative AI, while respecting and protecting creators and their works,” the release said.

“Bringing together Disney’s iconic stories and characters with OpenAI’s groundbreaking technology puts imagination and creativity directly into the hands of Disney fans in ways we’ve never seen before, giving them richer and more personal ways to connect with the Disney characters and stories they love.”
Disney shares jumped more than 2% at the opening of trading at 9:30a.m. ET.

News of the deal rocked the worlds of tech and entertainment Thursday in large part because Disney is so famously protective of its sprawling portfolio of intellectual property, from the animated shorts of the 1920s to modern superhero and fantasy franchises.

The studio has taken aggressive legal action, for years, to block the unauthorized use of its recognizable characters, logos and musical scores. Disney has also lobbied Congress for U.S. copyright extensions, including a 1998 federal law that some critics labeled the “Mickey Mouse Protection Act.”
To wit, Disney sent a cease-and-desist letter on Wednesday to OpenAI competitor Google, alleging that Google’s AI services infringe on Disney’s copyrights.
In the letter, Disney writes that it believes Google is “infringing Disney’s copyrights on a massive scale.”

“Disney has been raising its concerns with Google for months, but Google has done nothing in response,” Disney’s lawyer also writes. “Google’s mass infringement of Disney’s copyrighted works must stop.”
Disney said it is seeking a “swift response” from Google on the issue.
On Disney’s Nov. 13 earnings call, Iger hinted that the company was working on a deal with an AI company, but didn’t name any specific firms.
“We’ve been in some interesting conversations with some of the AI companies,” Iger said. “ I would characterize some of them as quite productive conversations.”

Iger said in those talks Disney was “seeking to not only protect the value of our IP and of our creative engines but also to seek opportunities for us to use their technology to create more engagement with consumers.”
This story originally appeared on NBCNews.com.

title: Kim Kardashian Says She Breaks This Parenting Rule Daily: 'I Never Thought I'd Be This Mom'
summary: Kim Kardashian revealed that her kids co-sleep with her each night. Here's why she lets them.
story: Motherhood has changed Kim Kardashian.

Before the reality TV star welcomed her four kids, North, 12, Saint, 10, Chicago, 7, and Psalm, 6, with Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, she said she would "never" be the type of mom who allows their kids to sleep in the same bed as her.
However, she said that quickly changed.

"There're always one or two kids in my bed every night. I never thought I'd be this mom that lets your kids sleep in bed with you. That was always like, 'I'm so not that mom,' but I am so that mom!" she said on Season 7, Episode 8, of "The Kardashians."
"And I don't care and my kids can sleep in my bed anytime they want," she added.
In the episode, Kardashian talked about her dynamic with her children and said they always keep her grounded.
"Obviously, everything I do is for my kids and they always ground me. Anytime I need a reality check, anytime I need to be so humbled, I just go home," she said with a smile.

She added, "One kid would be like, 'You're so lame, I can't believe you don't know what this word means,' or just like, 'Ugh, when are you going to get a facelift?' My kids will say crazy things and I'm just like, huh, OK."
Kardashian explained that she and her kids are so close that Saint even told her that he would like to live with her even when he's married.

"Saint said to me the other day, 'When I get married, 'I'll just live with you and then I'll go see my wife and then I'll just come back, right? Like I just sleep here.' And I was like, 'Totally!" she said with a smile.

title: Taylor Swift Reveals Her No. 1 Favorite Song From Her Own Discography
summary: Taylor Swift has a massive music catalog, but she named one song as her "No. 1" favorite.
story: Taylor Swift has a massive music catalog that spans 19 years, 12 albums and four re-recordings, but she says one song stands out among the rest.

While appearing on "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" on Dec. 10, the pop star was tasked with naming her top five favorite songs from her repertoire. As it turns out, it's not as easy as it sounds.
"Oh, my God, OK. This is so much pressure," she told Colbert, who was ready to document her list with pen and paper.
"So I think I’m gonna say that I’m gonna need a little time to get back to you on all the five," she said.
"I think I require a little bit of time to appreciate my work in a way. And it’s constantly changing, right?" she added.
"Too soon?" Colbert asked, referring to how she'd adjudicate her latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," which dropped Oct. 3.
"It’s a little too soon," she confirmed, before revealing her favorite track.
"I think No. 1 is 'All Too Well (10 Minute Version),'" Swift said as the crowd cheered.

"All Too Well" was first released in 2012 as part of Swift's fourth album, "Red." Then, as part of 2021's "Red (Taylor's Version)," she dropped a 10-minute, unabridged version of the song, which she has said she originally wrote at a rehearsal when she was 21 years old.
Beyond "All Too Well," Swift said she has a hard time objectively picking her other favorite songs, but notes she's "really obsessed" with "Life of a Showgirl" at the moment.

"I can’t really do any of the others. Except I will say somewhere in this list I think is gonna be a song called 'Mirrorball' from the 'Folklore' album," she said. "It came on the other day. A friend sent it to me and she was talking about it and I put it on and I was just like 'Mmm.' And then you ask me this question and so I said it."
Though she couldn't commit to a top 5 at the moment, Swift said she was open to revisiting the question in the future.
"We could do an update at some point if I have some time to look back,'" she said.
In response, Colbert worked in a cheeky nod to his show's recent cancellation and his upcoming last episode.
"You've got all the time you need between now and May," he joked.

title: Taylor Swift Reveals She Had the Stomach Flu 'Multiple Times' During 'Eras Tour'
summary: Taylor Swift reveals she had the stomach flu multiple times during the "Eras Tour" and shares why she never took any days off.
story: Before "The Eras Tour" even began, Taylor Swift knew she was not going to take any days off.
On the Dec. 10 episode of "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert," Swift recalled what it was like to perform on the "Eras Tour," which ran from March 2023 to December 2024.

"For me, when I'm on tour, especially the 'Eras Tour,' I just make a decision at the beginning of the tour that there's no option to not go on stage," she said. "That's not an option and it's not an option to perform like, 'I think I'll do this show at a level six tonight.' That's not an option."
She also revealed how she handled getting sick.
"Even if you have the stomach flu, which I had multiple times during the tour, my goal was, like, never let them know you have the stomach flu,” Swift said.
Even if she had a virus, one thing that helped her push through "physical pain" was her costumes — specifically her first outfit of the night, a bedazzled Versace bodysuit.
"I was constantly in a lot of physical pain, but when I put that on I was just like, 'No this is popping. I'm doing it,'" Swift said.

Of her more than 100 shows, Swift only had to cancel one set of dates. Three shows in Austria set for Aug. 8-10 in 2024 were canceled after a foiled terror plot. Swift later called the decision "devastating" but added she was thankful to authorities "because thanks to them, we were grieving concerts and not lives."
The "Life of a Showgirl" singer told Colbert she works so hard because she knows how much her fans support her.

"It's also about knowing there's something bigger than you, and for me on that tour, the bigger thing was these people have saved up their money, they have re-arranged their schedules, they have arranged transportation, they've had parties, they've created costumes, they've made sweatshirts, they've made friendship bracelets," she said. "I'm doing the show."
Swift's "Eras Tour" is said to be the highest-grossing concert tour of all time. During her last show in Vancouver, she expressed her gratitude to the fans who supported her all the way through.
“I want to thank every single one of you for being a part of the most thrilling chapter of my life so far,” she said.
Swift also described the tour as the “most exciting, powerful, most challenging thing” she has ever done.

Swift's appearance on "The Late Show" comes just one day before she releases an extended filmed version of "The Eras Tour" and her docuseries, "Taylor Swift: The End of an Era," which promises a behind-the-scenes look at life on tour.

title: Trump vows retaliation after two U.S. soldiers and an interpreter killed in Syria
summary: Two U.S. Army soldiers and a civilian U.S. interpreter were killed Saturday in an attack in Palmyra, Syria, the Pentagon said.
story: President Donald Trump vowed retaliation Saturday after two U.S. Army soldiers and a civilian U.S. interpreter were killed in an attack in Syria, an incident the Pentagon said occurred during a counterterrorism engagement.
"This was an ISIS attack against the U.S., and Syria, in a very dangerous part of Syria, that is not fully controlled by them," Trump said on Truth Social. "There will be very serious retaliation."

Three other U.S. personnel were wounded in the attack in Palmyra, Sean Parnell, the Pentagon’s chief spokesperson said on X. The attack occurred as the soldiers "were conducting a key leader engagement" in "support of ongoing counter-ISIS operations," he said.
"This attack is currently under active investigation," Parnell said.
U.S. Central Command said the attack was an ambush by "a lone ISIS gunman" and that the gunman was engaged and killed.
A Pentagon official told NBC News the attack occurred in an area outside the control of Syria’s interim president, Ahmed al-Sharaa.
